thread.title: Shia LaBeouf’s live stream taken down after shots fired in area
thread.title_full: Shia LaBeouf’s live stream taken down after shots fired in area

author: NICOLE BITETTE
title: Shia LaBeouf’s live stream taken down after shots fired in area
text:
Shia LaBeouf’s ‘He Will Not Divide Us’ live stream taken down after shots reportedly fired in the area Shia LaBeouf’s live stream taken down after shots fired in area Shia LaBeouf's "He Will Not Divide Us" installation was moved to the El Rey Theater in Albuquerque, New Mexico. (@thecampaignbook via Twitter)   9:07 AM 
Shia LaBeouf's main concern is the safety of the people. 
The actor-turned-artist announced that his relocated "He Will Not Divide Us" installation with his art collective LaBeouf, Rönkkö & Turner was shut down on Thursday after shots were fired. 
"We have taken the stream down after shots were reported in the area," LaBeouf wrote on Twitter Thursday morning. 
"The safety of everybody participating in our project is paramount," he continued. — Shia LaBeouf (@thecampaignbook) February 23, 2017 
It is not clear if the shots were fired at the location of the exhibit or just in the general vicinity. 
Albuquerque Police have not commented on the possible shooting incident. 
"He Will Not Divide Us" was shut down on Feb. 10 at the Museum of the Moving Image in Queens after it created an ongoing public safety hazard, according to the museum. LaBeouf visits the interactive installation he helped coordinate outside the Museum of the Moving Image in Queens before it was shut down.
